title: General
stimulusHtml:
6 points maximum; 2 points maximum per section

Muscle contraction

  • Motor neuron or axon terminal releases neurotransmitter or acetylcholine (ACh)

  • ACh binds to receptors

  • Depolarization or Na + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38B8@ moves in through membrane channels or membrane depolarizes

  • Action potential propagates along cell membrane (sarcolemma) or T tubules

  • Depolarization changes permeability of sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR) or Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ released from SR

  • Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ active transport into SR (reuptake of Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ )

  • Repolarization or maintenance of membrane potential ( Na + / K + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B52@ pump)

  • Smooth or cardiac muscle gap junctions directly transfer membrane potential between cells

Fertilization of an egg

  • Part of the acrosomal reaction or sperm acrosome releases hydrolytic enzymes (by exocytosis)

  • Sperm binds to receptors on egg

  • Fusion of sperm and egg plasma membranes

  • Change in membrane electrical charge or fast block (depolarization) to prevent further fertilization (polyspermy)

  • Cortical reaction or slow block by exocytosis (prevents polyspermy) or “hardening” of membrane

  • Separation of fertilization membrane (envelope)

  • Fusion of egg and sperm nuclear membranes or nuclei

Chemiosmotic production of ATP

  • Electron transport chain (ETC) in membrane pumps H + MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeisamaaCaaaleqabaGaae4kaaaaaaa@379A@ across membrane

  • H + MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeisamaaCaaaleqabaGaae4kaaaaaaa@379A@ gradient established across membrane

  • H + MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeisamaaCaaaleqabaGaae4kaaaaaaa@379A@ move through ATP synthase embedded in membrane to produce ATP

  • Membrane infolding increases surface area

Intercellular signaling

  • Release of chemical signals by exocytosis

  • Receptors in membrane bind ligands or chemical signals or chemical signals pass through the membrane (examples: neurotransmitters, hormones, pheromones)

  • Ligand-gated ion channels opening/closing

  • Cascade of cellular events, including enzymatic reactions and second messengers (examples: G-proteins, cAMP, I P 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3918@ , Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ )

  • Antibodies activate immune function

  • Descriptions of gap junctions, plasmodesmata (communicating junctions)
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

6 points maximum; 2 points maximum per section

Muscle contraction

  • Motor neuron or axon terminal releases neurotransmitter or acetylcholine (ACh)

  • ACh binds to receptors

  • Depolarization or Na + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38B8@ moves in through membrane channels or membrane depolarizes

  • Action potential propagates along cell membrane (sarcolemma) or T tubules

  • Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ active transport into SR (reuptake of Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ )

  • Membrane infolding increases surface area

Intercellular signaling

  • Release of chemical signals by exocytosis

  • Receptors in membrane bind ligands or chemical signals or chemical signals pass through the membrane (examples: neurotransmitters, hormones, pheromones)

  • Ligand-gated ion channels opening/closing

  • Cascade of cellular events, including enzymatic reactions and second messengers (examples: G-proteins, cAMP, I P 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3918@ , Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ )

  • Antibodies activate immune function

  • Descriptions of gap junctions, plasmodesmata (communicating junctions)

Intercellular signaling

  • Release of chemical signals by exocytosis

  • Receptors in membrane bind ligands or chemical signals or chemical signals pass through the membrane (examples: neurotransmitters, hormones, pheromones)

  • Ligand-gated ion channels opening/closing

  • Cascade of cellular events, including enzymatic reactions and second messengers (examples: G-proteins, cAMP, I P 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3918@ , Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ )

  • Antibodies activate immune function

  • Descriptions of gap junctions, plasmodesmata (communicating junctions)

Student response earns six of the available points.

6 points maximum; 2 points maximum per section

Muscle contraction

  • Motor neuron or axon terminal releases neurotransmitter or acetylcholine (ACh)

  • ACh binds to receptors

  • Depolarization or Na + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38B8@ moves in through membrane channels or membrane depolarizes

  • Action potential propagates along cell membrane (sarcolemma) or T tubules

  • Depolarization changes permeability of sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR) or Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ released from SR

  • Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ active transport into SR (reuptake of Ca 2+ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394E@ )

  • Repolarization or maintenance of membrane potential ( Na + / K + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B52@ pump)

  • Smooth or cardiac muscle gap junctions directly transfer membrane potential between cells

Fertilization of an egg

  • Part of the acrosomal reaction or sperm acrosome releases hydrolytic enzymes (by exocytosis)

  • Sperm binds to receptors on egg

  • Fusion of sperm and egg plasma membranes

  • Change in membrane electrical charge or fast block (depolarization) to prevent further fertilization (polyspermy)

  • Cortical reaction or slow block by exocytosis (prevents polyspermy) or “hardening” of membrane

  • Separation of fertilization membrane (envelope)

  • Fusion of egg and sperm nuclear membranes or nuclei
